Check something out. If you use software to offset your voice as you speak, it becomes harder and harder to talk...until it doesn't. After you reach that point, you can (almost) always automatically filter your own voice as noise. Speech Jammer (I don't have association with their app) does this well. Changing the offset changes the result, which helps to train your brain, but the very slight offset is super effective. Starting at 1/10 delay it only takes a few seconds to lose concentration. Going up, you naturally slow down, but decreasing becomes harder until a point.

After meeting my son's new middle school teacher, my friend asked me
what I thought of him.. I said. "he did not look me in the eye. I don't
think he likes women. I think he is a pedophile." I did not know why I
said that last thing, having never knowingly been faced with a
pedophile or contemplated pedophilia at all. It just came out of my
mouth. Over the next year, I noticed many strange things about that
teacher, as if my brain was watching out subconsciously. He had pizza
delivered to his classroom for male students during lunch period. He
offered money to boys to clean his classroom after school. He had a
weird paper clip on boys jeans zippers as some sort of "friction"
experiment. He asked my son to wash his car on the weekend for $50 (I
said "no."). He put my son on the varsity basketball team but refused to
play him even tho he attended every practice, per district rules. I
started going to every practice to make sure my son was participating
fully, and to make sure he was never alone with Mr. McP. I thought he
was trying to bargain sexual favors for playing time. Mr. McP phoned me
at home, thinking he could shut me down. I told him outright that I
thought he was a pedophile. I wrote a letter to be put in his district
file, specifying what I thought were inappropriate at best behaviors and
pedophile grooming behaviors at worst. I discussed him with the
principal and other teachers. My son hated me for being a helicopter Mom
where Mr. McP was concerned because all the boys thought Mr. McP was
the best teacher ever. Fast forward three years...Mr. McP was arrested
and convicted for sexually assaulting 11 boys. Two of them were in my
son's group of friends. One of the victim's was a cops son (and
neighbor) and one's parents even testified on his behalf at his trial!
The FBI agent that called me said I was listening to my primal brain and
it was alerting me to protect my son. He said "in our too polite
society we have stopped listening to our primal brain." I asked him if
he called me because he hurt my son (they had troves of evidence but
none involving my son) or saw the letter I thought the principal had
placed in his file. He said he could not confirm or deny seeing any
letter. He said he called me because they were calling all parents of
male students. He then added "parents that wrote a letter would have
been contacted first." I asked where I was on his contact list. He said
"in alphabetical order." That proved the principal did not put my letter
in that pedo's teacher file. Funny, she retired the day after Mr. McP
was arrested. My son apologized to me when he heard of McP's arrest. My
son is now a doctor and father and doing great in life. LISTEN TO YOUR
PRIMAL BRAIN!!!

In many cases, your intuition is right even though it seems like the thought out answer is right. Like the common thought experiment for utilitarianism. If a doctor had one healthy man, whose tissue type fit 5 people who needed different organ donations, he should kill the man to use the organs, as saving 5 lives and killing 1 person is better than letting 5 people die. This is completely non-intuitive, but it led to lots of people in our philosophy class concluding that utilitarianism is correct. However, your intuition is right, because people fail to remember that if things in this thought experiment were to happen in real life, it would lead to a chaotic society where no one can trust each other as you never know when you could be a “sacrifice” to save other people, this is why we have laws so people can live in harmony instead of fear. Yeah you’d be letting 5 people die but that’s much better than the alternative.

Today it seems places like NPR (and other places I'm sure) tell us to trust our gut to determine fake news; this idea is completely ludicrous and is why we have the alt-right today.  One cannot trust one's gut to determine what is true.  Only through rigorous proof involving logic and actual evidence can one determine what is true.
